context.introduction: Discover simple Japanese dishes and the basics of presentation. Learn about miso soup, onigiri, and the importance of color and garnish.

sections.title: Miso Soup: The Classic Starter
sections.content: Miso soup is a basic Japanese dish made with dashi and miso paste, often served as the first course.

sections.title: Color on the Plate
sections.content: A balanced Japanese plate features five colors: red, yellow, green, white, and black.

sections.title: Onigiri: Rice Balls
sections.content: Onigiri are rice balls shaped by hand, often filled with savory ingredients and wrapped in nori.

sections.title: Garnishes
sections.content: Common Japanese garnishes include green onions, sesame seeds, and pickled ginger.

sections.title: Presentation Tips
listItems: Use contrasting colors for visual appeal
Garnish just before serving for best flavor
